etymologies: modern Latin, named in honor of Leonhard Fuchs (1501–66), German botanist

definitions: a shrub with pendulous tubular flowers that are typically of two contrasting colors. They are native to America and New Zealand and are commonly grown as ornamentals.

notes.text: Genus Fuchsia, family Onagraceae: many cultivars

definitions: a vivid purplish-red color like that of the sepals of a typical fuchsia flower.
shortDefinitions: vivid purplish-red color like that of sepals of typical fuchsia flower
